natural problem: On Marika's $8^{\text{th}}$ birthday, in 2004, her father said, ''My age is now four times your age.'' In what year will Marika's father be able to say, ''My age is now three times your age,'' on Marika's birthday?
natural solution: If Marika is 8 years old, and her father is four times her age, then her father is $4\cdot 8 = 32$ years old.

So now $x$ years after 2004, Marika will be $8+x$ years old and her father will be $32+x$ years old. If the father's age is three times Marika's age then: \begin{align} 32+x &= 3(8+x)\\ 32+x &= 24+3x\\

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes marika_age father_age :: nat
assumes h0 : "marika_age = 8"
and h1 : "father_age = 4 * marika_age"
and h2 : "\<forall> n. n > 0 \<longrightarrow> (father_age + n = 3 * (marika_age + n)) \<longrightarrow> (2004 + n) = (2004 + marika_age + n)"
shows  "2004 + marika_age = 2008"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 On Marika's $8^{\text{th}}$ birthday, in 2004, her father said, ''My age is now four times your age.'' In what year will Marika's father be able to say, ''My age is now three times your age,'' on Marika's birthday? The final Answer is 2008
 ### Proof
 If Marika is 8 years old, and her father is four times her age, then her father is $4\cdot 8 = 32$ years old.
 So now $x$ years after 2004, Marika will be $8+x$ years old and her father will be $32+x$ years old. If the father's age is three times Marika's age then: \begin{align} 32+x &= 3(8+x)\\ 32+x &= 24+3x\\
 2x &= 8\\ x &=4 \end{align}So the year is $2004+4 = \boxed{2008}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes marika_age father_age :: nat
assumes h0 : "marika_age = 8"
and h1 : "father_age = 4 * marika_age"
and h2 : "\<forall> n. n > 0 \<longrightarrow> (father_age + n = 3 * (marika_age + n)) \<longrightarrow> (2004 + n) = (2004 + marika_age + n)"
shows  "2004 + marika_age = 2008"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Marika is currently 8 years old, and her father is 4 times her age. In what year will her father be 3 times as old as Marika? The final answer is 2008.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes M F Y :: int
assumes h0 : "M = 8"
and h1 : "F = 4 * M"
and h2 : "Y = 2004"
and h3 : "\<forall> y. y > Y \<longrightarrow> (F + (y - Y)) = 3 * (M + (y - Y))"
shows  "Ex (\<lambda> y. y > Y \<and> (F + (y - Y)) = 3 * (M + (y - Y)) \<and> y = 2008)"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 On Marika's $8^{\text{th}}$ birthday, in 2004, her father said, ''My age is now four times your age.'' In what year will Marika's father be able to say, ''My age is now three times your age,'' on Marika's birthday? The final Answer is 2008
 ### Proof
 If Marika is 8 years old, and her father is four times her age, then her father is $4\cdot 8 = 32$ years old.
 So now $x$ years after 2004, Marika will be $8+x$ years old and her father will be $32+x$ years old. If the father's age is three times Marika's age then: \begin{align} 32+x &= 3(8+x)\\ 32+x &= 24+3x\\
 2x &= 8\\ x &=4 \end{align}So the year is $2004+4 = \boxed{2008}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes M F Y :: int
assumes h0 : "M = 8"
and h1 : "F = 4 * M"
and h2 : "Y = 2004"
and h3 : "\<forall> y. y > Y \<longrightarrow> (F + (y - Y)) = 3 * (M + (y - Y))"
shows  "Ex (\<lambda> y. y > Y \<and> (F + (y - Y)) = 3 * (M + (y - Y)) \<and> y = 2008)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: In the year 2004, there are 8 males and 32 females in a town. Every year after 2004, the population of females increases by the same number as the males. However, the total population of females is always three times that of males. In what year does this situation first occur after 2004? The answer is 2008.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes year :: nat and Marika Father :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "Marika 2004 = 8"
and h1 : "Father 2004 = 4 * Marika 2004"
and h2 : "\<forall>year. year > 2004 \<longrightarrow> (Father year = 3 * Marika year \<longrightarrow> year = 2008)"
shows  "Father 2008 = 3 * Marika 2008"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 On Marika's $8^{\text{th}}$ birthday, in 2004, her father said, ''My age is now four times your age.'' In what year will Marika's father be able to say, ''My age is now three times your age,'' on Marika's birthday? The final Answer is 2008
 ### Proof
 If Marika is 8 years old, and her father is four times her age, then her father is $4\cdot 8 = 32$ years old.
 So now $x$ years after 2004, Marika will be $8+x$ years old and her father will be $32+x$ years old. If the father's age is three times Marika's age then: \begin{align} 32+x &= 3(8+x)\\ 32+x &= 24+3x\\
 2x &= 8\\ x &=4 \end{align}So the year is $2004+4 = \boxed{2008}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes year :: nat and Marika Father :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
assumes h0 : "Marika 2004 = 8"
and h1 : "Father 2004 = 4 * Marika 2004"
and h2 : "\<forall>year. year > 2004 \<longrightarrow> (Father year = 3 * Marika year \<longrightarrow> year = 2008)"
shows  "Father 2008 = 3 * Marika 2008"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: In the year 2004, Marika was 8 years old and her father was 4 times her age. In a certain year after 2004, her father's age was 3 times her age. What was her father's age in the year 2008? The final answer is 3 times Marika's age in 2008.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes marika_father_age marika_age year :: nat
assumes h0 : "marika_age = 8"
and h1 : "year = 2004"
and h2 : "marika_father_age = 4 * marika_age"
and h3 : "\<forall> year. marika_father_age + (year - 2004) = 3 * (marika_age + (year - 2004))"
shows  "year = 2008"
a_3.formal solution:

 On Marika's $8^{\text{th}}$ birthday, in 2004, her father said, ''My age is now four times your age.'' In what year will Marika's father be able to say, ''My age is now three times your age,'' on Marika's birthday? The final Answer is 2008

 2x &= 8\\ x &=4 \end{align}So the year is $2004+4 = \boxed{2008}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes marika_father_age marika_age year :: nat

a_3.informal problem: In 2004, Marika is 8 years old and her father is 4 times as old as she is. In what year will Marika's father be three times as old as Marika? The answer is 2008.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes Marika Father :: nat
assumes h0 : "Father = 4 * Marika"
and h1 : "Marika = 8"
and h2 : "\<forall> y. y > 2004 \<longrightarrow> (Father + (y - 2004)) = 3 * (Marika + (y - 2004))"
shows  "y = 2008"

 On Marika's $8^{\text{th}}$ birthday, in 2004, her father said, ''My age is now four times your age.'' In what year will Marika's father be able to say, ''My age is now three times your age,'' on Marika's birthday? The final Answer is 2008
 ### Proof
 If Marika is 8 years old, and her father is four times her age, then her father is $4\cdot 8 = 32$ years old.

theorem
fixes Marika Father :: nat

a_4.informal problem: Marika's age in 2004 was 8 and her father was four times as old as she was. In what year after 2004 will Marika's age be a third of her father's age? The final answer is 2008.

shows  "\<exists>future_year. future_year > year \<and> (father_age + (future_year - year)) = 3 * (marika_age + (future_year - year)) \<and> future_year = 2008"

a_6.informal problem: In the year 2004, Marika is 8 years old, and her father is 4 times as old as her. In what future year will her father be 3 times as old as Marika? The final answer is 2008.

a_7.informal problem: Marika is currently 8 years old, and her father is four times her age. In how many years will her father be three times as old as Marika? The final answer is 4.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes marika_age father_age year :: nat
assumes h0 : "marika_age = 8"
and h1 : "year = 2004"
and h2 : "father_age = 4 * marika_age"
and h3 : "\<forall>future_year future_marika_age future_father_age. future_year > year \<and> future_marika_age = marika_age + (future_year - year) \<and> future_father_age = father_age + (future_year - year) \<longrightarrow> (future_father_age \<noteq> 3 * future_marika_age)"
shows  "False"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 On Marika's $8^{\text{th}}$ birthday, in 2004, her father said, ''My age is now four times your age.'' In what year will Marika's father be able to say, ''My age is now three times your age,'' on Marika's birthday? The final Answer is 2008
 ### Proof
 If Marika is 8 years old, and her father is four times her age, then her father is $4\cdot 8 = 32$ years old.
 So now $x$ years after 2004, Marika will be $8+x$ years old and her father will be $32+x$ years old. If the father's age is three times Marika's age then: \begin{align} 32+x &= 3(8+x)\\ 32+x &= 24+3x\\
 2x &= 8\\ x &=4 \end{align}So the year is $2004+4 = \boxed{2008}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes marika_age father_age year :: nat
assumes h0 : "marika_age = 8"
and h1 : "year = 2004"
and h2 : "father_age = 4 * marika_age"
and h3 : "\<forall>future_year future_marika_age future_father_age. future_year > year \<and> future_marika_age = marika_age + (future_year - year) \<and> future_father_age = father_age + (future_year - year) \<longrightarrow> (future_father_age \<noteq> 3 * future_marika_age)"
shows  "False"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_8.informal problem: In the year 2004, Marika is 8 years old, and her father is 4 times her age. Is there a future year in which her father will be exactly 3 times her age? The answer is no (False).

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes marika_age father_age year :: nat
assumes h0 : "marika_age = 8"

shows  "year = 2008"

(* ### Problem
 On Marika's $8^{\text{th}}$ birthday, in 2004, her father said, ''My age is now four times your age.'' In what year will Marika's father be able to say, ''My age is now three times your age,'' on Marika's birthday? The final Answer is 2008

 2x &= 8\\ x &=4 \end{align}So the year is $2004+4 = \boxed{2008}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes marika_age father_age year :: nat
assumes h0 : "marika_age = 8"
and h1 : "year = 2004"

and h3 : "\<forall> y. y > year \<longrightarrow> (father_age + (y - year)) = 3 * (marika_age + (y - year)) \<longrightarrow> y = 2008"
shows  "year = 2008"

a_9.informal problem: In 2004, Marika is 8 years old, and her father is 4 times her age. In what year will her father be 3 times as old as Marika? The final answer is 2008.
